question.content:
I also dont think this is economical interesting.

But lets get into the theory:
You have 10 Instruments. and 10 Songs in the Game you can buy/learn.  You need a 'song line' for the instrument to record and if another player in a radius of x-metres joins the 'Music-Play' and he has the track learned he can join the Musical-Group.

Just by this you have 100 different SKills you could learn.

Its a concept which is also affordable to develop in a game and not too hard. Also giving Content for the players

referenced_message.content: Right. It's not impossble or unfeasible. But it is not as simple as letting people press a key to make a sound. No one would be happy with that version of it.

answer.content: Sure, that sounds like a sensible starting point for such a system, frankly. "Affordable" is a very context sensitive qualifier though. It all comes down to priorities, too. It's not merely "do we make a music playing feature" or not, it's choosing to do it versus something else, and the many many many knock on effects. Maybe a naive implementation ends up annihilating server performance? What if all the network traffic for that ends up doubling server costs in practice? What about people intentionally being a noise nuisance to others? This just a tiny slice of the amount that has to go into making a thoughtful, quality, cozy welcoming world for everyone.
